CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. B2, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Jewel Wright - Harris Photo." Article reads: "Pearl West Makes Lovely Bride in Bethany Ritual - Bethany Baptist Church was the setting recently for the marriage of Pearl West to Jewel Wight, son of Mrs. Melinda Wright of Portsmouth, Ohio.  Rev. Charles E. Tames officiated.  The bride's gown was of white silk organza with sequin trimming.  She carried a bouquet of white roses.  Nancy West was maid of honor and Joyce Jones was a bridesmaid.  Both wore identical ankle length gowns of pale green silk organza.  The Groom's attendants were Haskell Wright, best man; and ushers were: Wanda Wright, Ernest West and Clifford Hopewell.  Toya West and Roxanne Grinage were attractive flower girls.  Senior aides included: Mrs. Gladys Brent and Mrs. Patricia Gardner.  Junior aides were: Geraldine Spargens, Joyce Self, Barbara Weston, Ann Lewis, Patricia Jackson and Yvonne Thomas.  The rehearsal dinner was held at the Greene Hearthe [sic] by the bride's aunt Mrs. Olivia Couch and her cousin, Shirley Couch.  From out-of-town came Mrs. Melinda Wright, mother of the groom, and son, Wanda, from Portsmouth; the Ernest Smiths and son from Kentucky; Mrs. Nannie West, grandmother of the bride; the Ernest Wests, Mrs. Emma Baptist, Ernest B. West, Clifford Hopewell and Howard [illegible]kins of Long Island, N.Y."
TitMainTitle: Man walking bride Pearl West Wright wearing crown with long veil and pearl necklace, down aisle of Bethany Baptist Church, for her wedding to Jewel Wright
